title: Nasty Dealer - BlackJack
generalRule: The goal of the game is to beat the dealer's hand without going over 21. Each player starts with two cards, the dealer will have one card hidden until their turn starts. Dealer will hit until their hand is 16, and stand on 17 or higher. You bust if you go over 21 and the dealer wins regardless of their hand. If you are dealt 21 from the start (Ace & 10 or picture card), you got a blackjack.
double: You double your bet and only draw one more card and end your turn. (You can only double on your first move of your hand after the cards have been dealt and if you chose to split, the same rules apply for each split hand.)
split: You can only split when you have two of the same card - the pair is split into two separate hands. Splitting also requires you to bet the same value as the original bet for the new split hand. You cannot play on two aces after they are split.
bet: You must place your bet before each hand, min. $25 - max. $5,000. You can clear your bet and set the amount of chips you wish to bet by clicking on the corresponding chip(s).
insurance: If the dealer's face up card is an Ace, you may opt to buy insurance, which is the same value as your original bet, and if the dealer has BlackJack, you will be paid out 2 to 1. If the dealer does not have BlackJack, the insurance bet is forfeited to the dealer
surrender: At the start of your turn, you may chose to surrender and have half your bet returned and the other half forfeited to the dealer.
cardValues: When playing Blackjack the numeral cards 2 to 10 have their face values, Jacks, Queens and Kings are valued at 10, and Aces can have a value of either 1 or 11. The Ace is always valued at 11 unless that would result in the hand going over 21, in which case it is valued as 1. Any hand with an Ace valued as 11 is called a ‘soft’ hand. All other hands are ‘hard’ hands.A starting hand of a 10 valued card and an Ace is called a Blackjack or natural and beats all hands other than another Blackjack. If both the player and dealer have Blackjack, the result is a push (tie): neither the player nor the bank wins and the bet is returned to the player.
